intro: Goniophlebium reinwardtii, commonly known as the Reinwardt's spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. It has a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
